alert.note: Alert for St. Tammany (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 29 at 2:54PM CST until February 02 at 1:13AM CST by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in New Orleans LA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Louisiana... Tickfaw River Near Holden affecting Livingston Parish. Tchefuncte River Above U.S. Highway 190 Near Covington affecting St. Tammany Parish. For the Tickfaw River...including Liverpool, Holden, Killian, Montpelier...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Tchefuncte River...including Folsom, U.S. Highway 190 Near Covington...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO EARLY THURSDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Tchefuncte River Above U.S. Highway 190 Near Covington. * WHEN...From this evening to early Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...At 22.0 feet, Tchefuncte River camp grounds will be under a few inches of water. The Goodbee community is threatened with flooding. Water will invade Camp Tchefuncte`s parking lot. Vehicles must be removed to higher ground. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:30 PM CST Sunday the stage was 16.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this evening to a crest of 22.0 feet early tomorrow afternoon. - Flood stage is 20.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 22.1 feet on 01/02/2007. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/lix. Click on the Rivers and Lakes menu for forecasts and observations. The next statement will be issued when updates are needed.
